title: Equality (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Enforcement of Court Orders
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Enforcement of Court Orders 

(Legal Aid) (Amendment) Regulations 2024.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited enforcement court order (legal aid) (amendment) regulation 2024

title: Equality (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020
heading: In these Regulations, “Regulations of 2009” means the Enforcement of
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Regulations of 2009” means the Enforcement of 

Court Orders (Legal Aid) Regulations 2009 (S.I. No. 301 of 2009).
text_norm: 2 regulation regulation 2009 mean enforcement court order (legal aid) regulation 2009 (s.i no 301 2009)

title: Equality (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020
heading: 3. (1) Subject to Regulation 4, the Regulations of 2009 are amended by the
text_raw:
3. (1) Subject to Regulation 4, the Regulations of 2009 are amended by the 
substitution of the Schedule set out in Schedule 1 to these Regulations for 
Schedule 2 (amended by Regulation 3 of the Enforcement of Court Orders 
(Legal Aid) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (No. 363 of 2011)). 

(2) This Regulation shall be deemed to have come into operation on 1 

January 2024.
text_norm: 3 (1) subject regulation 4 regulation 2009 amended substitution schedule set schedule 1 regulation schedule 2 (amended regulation 3 enforcement court order (legal aid) (amendment) regulation 2011 (no 363 2011)) (2) regulation shall deemed come operation 1 january 2024

title: Equality (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020
heading: 4. (1) The Regulations of 2009 are amended by the substitution of the
text_raw:
4. (1) The Regulations of 2009 are amended by the substitution of the 
Schedule set out in Schedule 2 to these Regulations for Schedule 2 (amended by 
Regulation 4). 

(2) This Regulation shall come into operation on 1 January 2025. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 3rd January, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [743] 3
text_norm: 4 (1) regulation 2009 amended substitution schedule set schedule 2 regulation schedule 2 (amended regulation 4) (2) regulation shall come operation 1 january 2025 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 3rd january 2025 743 3

title: Equality (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020
heading: “SCHEDULE 2
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1 

“SCHEDULE 2 

Part 1 

SOLICITOR’S FEE 

Proceedings in District Court 

Fee in respect of proceedings: 

€221.65 per case 

Part 2 

SOLICITOR’S FEE 

Appeal against order for imprisonment of debtor 

Fee in respect of an appeal against an order for imprisonment of a debtor 

made under paragraph (c) or (d) of subsection (7) of section 6 (inserted 

by section 2 of the Act of 2009) of the Act of 1940: 

€221.65 per case 

Part 3 

SOLICITOR’S FEE 

Hearing by High Court of case stated 

Fee in respect of the hearing by the High Court of a case stated: 

€1,466.19 per case 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [743] 

Part 4 

COUNSEL’S FEE 

Hearing by High Court of case stated 

Fee in respect of the hearing by the High Court of a case stated: 

€1,466.19 per case”. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [743] 5

title: Equality (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020

SCHEDULE 2

Part 1 

SOLICITOR’S FEE

€239.38 per case 

Part 2 

SOLICITOR’S FEE 

Appeal against order for imprisonment of debtor 

Fee in respect of an appeal against an order for imprisonment of a debtor 

made under paragraph (c) or (d) of subsection (7) of section 6 (inserted 

by section 2 of the Act of 2009) of the Act of 1940: 

€239.38 per case 

Part 3 

SOLICITOR’S FEE 

Hearing by High Court of case stated 

Fee in respect of the hearing by the High Court of a case stated: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [743] 

€1,583.48 per case 

Part 4 

COUNSEL’S FEE

Fee in respect of the hearing by the High Court of a case stated: 

€1,583.48 per case”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 December, 2024. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice.
